values:
New LJ.

Ask for Address.

Goodbye.

If you call someone a bitch, they can't speak out to justify their opinion, because then they'll seem more of a "bitch."
Nor can they simply stay quiet, because then they're subsiding to the perpretrator.
The best you could possibly due is walk away, but still.
There must be some form of passive resistence that I've looked over.
And what if you're being called a bitch, behind your back?
What do you do then?

Odd thing I heard today. There were these girls, making fun of someone because of the way they laughed.
It's sad to think there's someone out there who hates your laugh, just because it doesn't sound "right," or "cool."
Would you rather hear them cry?
Would you rather make them cry?

Strange thing I heard today. So there's this girl chasing after a guy who just broke up with his GF.
She's been calling the GF a jerkface and shiet.
Then the GF goes up to the girl and says she hopes she doesn't hate her.
Haha. The girl says the GF is so nice, and never spoke to her a word before she met her.

Why do people judge you before they get to know you?
Please don't tell me that you don't need to know a person before you can decide whether you like or dislike someone.
Please don't tell me that you don't decide to like or dislike someone, that you just "feel" it.
If you've no reason, why are you still hating?
If you've a reason, is it really a sensible one?

This is what I listened to all day. 
And I didn't like what I heard.
Hey, try it. 
Sit down in class and don't say anything.
And you might hear it too.

Happy Birthday Natalie!
Keisha, Claudia and I decorated her locker this morning.
With wrapping paper, ribbon, and anime pictures.
Oh yeahs.

Today I received a rose.
However I suspect that it's already dying on me.
I can't ever seem to tend to flowers very well.

Hey hey.
Wouldn't white roses be prettier?
Dipped in red fabric paint?
That'd be spectacular =)

In English we're reading a MidSummer Night's Dream.
I don't care what people say, I think Shakespeare is a genious.
Although the plots are somewhat boring and bleh.
The composition just bleeds.
I love it.

Had a science quiz today.
OPEN BOOK.
Hopefully it'll bring up my mark.
'Cause I got 74% on the last 2 quizzes.
And a 70% on my Chem. lab.
And my midterm was 86%.
Fuck Science.

Current Addictions: Loveholic, The Spill Canvas, Gazette.
Yeah. Korean pop, Western Acoustic and Japanese Visual Rock.
Hee hee.

I'm not really into writing much anymore.
Using long sentences and the like.
There's mere content in stringing words together uselessly.
My thoughts don't run as far.

But I write in my journal daily.
So if you see me scribbling in a blue notebook, don't come near.
I'm more distracted with it then with class work.
Maybe that's why my grades are dropping.
*sigh*

Today I put all my clean laundry into a basket and let it sit in the corner of my room for about half the day. By the end when I dumped out all my clothes onto my bed they were of course, wrinkled and stretched. I thought, "Hey, this is a great time to bust out an iron," and that's exactly what I did.

It took me half an hour to find it at first. My mom and dad had went out to go buy groceries so I couldn't ask where it was. Then I dragged it all the way to my room, put on some Loveholic (korean band) and switched on the iron. 

I kid you not, I suck at ironing. I touched the hot metal plate more than once and I'm surprised the flesh on my hand hasn't melted away or something. My shirts came out more wrinkled then before, even if I turned them inside out and ironed the other side. Ironing is some damn tricky business I tell you. After attemping to iron about five articles of clothing, and hour had passed, I was getting sore and decided to stop. 

So my next goal to accomplish is ironing. Which comes after finishing a story, making 1000 paper cranes and stars, and a few others random shit you don't even care about.

Tomorrow is the Xmas party. Oh yeah. It'll be my family and a bunch of other families, with beer an alcohol. How lovely.

This Christmas my family is going away for 10 days. We usually sgo on vacations during the holidays. My parents exclaim that this'll be the last few years until David and I got to University so they're attempting to cram in some family time. Ugh.

School ends for the holidays at the end of December 22nd. However, no one really goes to school on the last day before vacations anyways. I'll be leaving at 3am on the 22nd, so I won't have to bother with the non existent classes.  

We plan on driving down to New Orleans and staying there for a night (2days). We will be going with my Uncle's family (mother's side) which includes my Uncle, Aunt, Andy and Sandy (Vietnamese people love rhyming names). Afterwards, we will take a flight to Las Vegas and stay there for (3 days). Afterwards, we will take another flight, this one to Las Angeles, and stay there for (3 days). Then we intend on flying back to New Orleans, and driving back (2days). 

This year, I plan on buying a Santa Clause hat. Yes, the red cap with a white fluffy pom pom at the end. They're freaking cute. David wants one too. So we've made a goal to get them this year, and wear them on Christmas. Haha. We're strange. 

Yesterday I bought a new type of Pocky. Normally I just buy the ones that have chocolate, but the one I bought had almond and chocolate. It was expensive too, $3.99, but it was hella good. I'm going to buy crushed almond chocolate Pocky from now on whenever I can and have the chance to. 

Funny thing that happened with the cafe ladies the other day. Kathleen bought 2 fudge cookies ($1) and handed them a $10 bill. However they gave her back $19. LOL. I've been getting Kathleen to buy me lunches all week. I really am a glutton. Although I should probably go back to eating my, as we say, "healthy" sandwiches and bagels. 

Hm. Nah. 

I've been craving chocolate like mad now. It's so good. I remember reading up about something that said eating chocolate can make people feel good. I agree.

If you ever read this.
I hope you know.
I'm pretty sad.
Maybe you aren't.
But I still am.
Alright?
Fair enough.

Oh Em Gee.

I finally got a watch.

Now I don't need to keep annoying other people.

Just thought I'd share that.

#1
Mom: Do you ever feel as if you hate your parents so much that you wish they were gone?
Me: Yes, many times.
Mom [insert incredulous look]: Why?
Me [sarcasm]: Oh I don't know
Mom: You shouldn't do that. Parents have feelings too. What would you do if your child hated you?
Me: Kick them out.
Mom: You can't do that. 
Me: Sure you could.
Mom: You shouldn't be angry at your children, you have to learn to love them.
Me: Clearly you haven't.
Mom: One day when you have a family, is that what you want to do? Kick your children out?
Me: I don't want a family. 
Mom: Oh you talk big now, but one day you'll find out. You'll think that in the future you'll be able to get away from your parents, haha that won't happen.
Me: ....
Mom: You have the exact genes of your grandmother.
Me: ....
Mom: C'mon, go outside. And throw this garbadge out. [throws old kleenexes at me]


#2
Dad: Don't bring any food upstairs! You're going to make a mess.
Me: [sits down and eats]
David enters kitchen, opens refrigerator and cupboard, goes back upstairs with yogurt and chips.
Me: ....


#3
Dad: Tammy go wash the dishes.
Me: [goes to wash dishes]
Dad: [sits down, flips through TV channels with remote]
3 hours later
Mom: [comes home]
Mom: Why didn't you cook any food?
Dad: I was sleeping the whole day
Me: ....


#4
Me: [cooking dinner]
Dad: Make some for John and David you selfish brat. Call them down after too.
Next Day
Mom: [cooking dinner]
John: Do you want me to go get Tammy?
Mom: No she'll come down if she's hungry
A few hours later
Me: What's for dinner?
Dad: You should have come down when we told you too. Don't ask me what's for dinner! I work so many hours a day and you do nothing in this house! If it weren't for me you'd be dead
Me: ....


#5
Me: I got 87% for mid term.
Dad: GET HIGHER GRADES. Stop being so lazy!
David: I got 72%.
Dad: Okay.

 

---------------------------------------------------------

Now does anyone see?
Why I strongly despise living with these people?
And people wonder why I'm so quiet. 
As if talking back helps any damned situation.
Too bad nothing can be changed.
Fucked up stubborn family with their gender inequality, idiotic expectations and for just being a freaking pain.
They make living seem like a chore to be earned.
I'm not willing to earn it though.

Last night I went to bed around 11pm. I was completely tired, which is ironic because I had had a nap only three hours before. Anyhow, somehow I didn't manage to fall asleep until 2am. I lay there, staring at the clock, the ceiling. Sometimes I sat up, contemplated turning on the light and going on the computer or reading, but then I realized I'd end up waking my brother, or my mom or dad would come into my room and scold me. 

I woke up this morning, still tired, around 9am. I'm really sore, so I've been at my desk or in bed all day. I've got a sore throat too, and I'm just not in the greatest mood.

If there's anyone out there whose outstanding at Physics, please IM me. I freaking hate this unit, and I'm have difficulty with acceleration problems. 

Work now, bitch later.

I must first begin this entry with one of the biggest disappointments of my life.

Last night we ordered Chinese take-out for dinner. I asked my mother to bring home sweet 'n sour pork, because it's my favourite dish. While opening the containers, I was thouroughly shocked. They had the pork covered in flour alright, but the sauce was SEPERATE! You couldn't believe my astonishment. It tasted like crap. Damn Canadianized Chinese food. What makes it worse was that it was apparently 7$. SEVEN BUCKS for a tiny container of CRAP. I continued emoing three hours afterwards.

Today, in search of a Frou Frou CD, Joseph and I headed to the mall. Seeing as I live approximately 15 minutes away from the mall, walking seemed suitable. On the way you have to cross through the Canadian Tire parking lot into the Sears one. In between there's a hill, grass and all. I had failed to observe it had snowed earlier today, and you can guess what happened. I slipped. Fortunately I didn't fall face first. Unfortunately, that was embarassing haha. Mind you, I was much more concerned about the camera, because I was carrying my Dad's 7.1 megapixel. And if a) he found out I took it without asking and/or b) he found out I slipped in the mud and it was horrible then I'd be in shit. Anyways 4 hours later this is what my jeans look like.

Front Side


Back Side


Back Pocket


So at the mall when we got there I tried cleaning the case, although it didn't really help. I got alot of weird stares too. Whether it's because I was all muddy or I was cleaning a camera case, I really don't know. Some people inquired, some others just stared strangely. Freaking busybodies.

We went into Sunrise and couldn't find Frou Frou. Then we headed to Music World, I was pretty sure it wouldn't be there but low and behold, it was. Joseph bought it, I wouldn't take it, so he exchanged it for Damien Rice. I went to the food court, got napkins at New York Fries, and afterwards the camera case was CLEAN.

Then headed to HMV, bought nothing, but Joseph got Broken Social Scene and Death From Above 1979.

Many do not realize the importance of the month of December. For many, it's just another day closer to a selfish Christmas, or just another day to look forward to another snowfall. But for me, it's the last month of the year, to repent for the past and to accomplish all those goals that I had made at the start of 2006.

The sky is becoming gray again, the air is becoming cold.

So I start this month off with a few dreary pictures to reflect my mood.

 
 


How I plan on ending this month, is currently undecided.

What will happen, is in God's hands.

It's not funny.

So please stop laughing.

I'm not smiling.

So please stop mocking.

I'm not fine.

So please fuck off.

I don't care if you had good intentions S., I told you not to, and you still go against me, lie to me, and then tell me a completely twisted and fucked up story. After asking like five different people, I finally find out what you said. It's ironic how they all tell me not to jump you and to just fucking leave you alone. 

But you didn't leave me alone.

Karma bitch. Karma.

What goes around will come around.

AND I saw that disgusting face you made at me. OH, you probably thought I didn't see anything right? Hah. Then you go and act like everything's normal, while you continue to smack talk about me when I'm walking fucking right in front of you.

You enjoy this don't you? 

Gees.

You deserve to be shot, slowly.

Why isn't anyone telling me anything that's going on?

7 fucking hours later I learn everything that happens today, everything that involves me. yet, doesn't involve me?

Where was I when all this happened?

I don't want to go to school anymore.

I don't want to see my friends anymore.

I don't want to see anyone... anymore.

I don't think this is getting anywhere, I don't think I'm getting anywhere with this whole situation.

Tear.

Why?

Because I'm selfish.

I guess I could, stuff in more words that would lower my self esteem.

But right now.

It kills.

I want to chop off my hair.
It's annoying me, ALOT.
Maybe I'll keep it at shoulder length. 
The more I stare at it, the more I hate it.
But maybe I'll try and grow it out long.
Straighten it everyday until it's so fried.
Wait for years and years.

I'm now in love with the word hate.
I write it everywhere now. 
I don't think I can go anywhere in my room and not see it.

I really am a bitter kid.

"If it's light, and changes to dark, you can't see anything.
But if it's dark from the beginning, you begin to see."

Think about it.
It's my favourite quote of the month.
Not as poetically beautiful as others but it makes hella sense to me.
It seems like it's always been so dark...

It's kind of obvious how depressing I am to be around.
But in a way it's kind of not.

Hate. hatehatehatehate.

Myself.

" I'll be just fine,
pretending I'm not "


Why is sympathy such a horrid thing? It's recently come to my attention that the very word "sympathy" or "pity" has now become a degrading term. But I am here to tell you it simply is not.

The very word sympathy means, in essence, to be compassionate. When we are sympathising, or pitying, we take in the sorrow, pain, and suffering of others and try our best to treat it as our own. Sometimes we can, because we've faced a similiar tragedy in the past, and sometimes we can't. We're not looking down at you when we tell you "I'm sorry." We're not thinking any less of you when we say that. Everyone unconsiously seeks out sympathy. So please don't sit there, whining, telling us that you don't want it, because we all know perfectly well that you'll call us uncompassionate bitches if we don't.

This goes out to all those children who cry thereselves to sleep tonight. Who clutch their heads in bed, and scream to the world while no one's listening. To the children who laugh but no sound is heard. To the children who cry and no sound is made. To any person out there who feels as if no one is there. To everyone who thinks that no one even cares.

Because I sympathise for you.

Yay for random hangouts on Saturday nights. Here's some pictures to feed on. 
I have some video clips as well but those'll probably end up rotting on my hard drive.

Here's some recent photos from today's swim meet.





 



And here's a few miscellaneous ones I took the other day.

 
 


Alot of them are blurry because my hands are pretty unsteady when I take the pictures. I'm trying to work on that =/

I love how people regard me as smart. It's ironic because I'm really secretly unsmart. 

In Science class today, we were given 20 minutes at the end of class to work on our homework. I continued to talk to Victoria, because I really did not want to do my work. She left to go to the washroom, and when she came back I said "I'm having a hell of a time pretending I'm doing my work when I'm really not," and she replied with a "I know, you're quite good at that." 

Honestly, if you ever have a class with me, you'll hate me by the end of Week 1. I do not do my work in class. Exceptions go to if I'm going out in the afternoon and don't want to be up until 11pm doing homework, but normally I slack off. I sit there, doodle, talk to whoever is sitting beside me, distract THEM from THEIR work and we've got a combination for disastor.  

Next semester I have Math (Vander Doelen), Computer Sciences (Walker), Art (Vanhouten) and History (Warecki), along with Lunch C and B. Anyone have anything with me =D ? This'll be a great way to know who I can bother when Semester 2 starts x] 

So afterschool today Shannon, Kathleen and I decided to stay and do absolutely nothing with our time. We didn't really feel like going home, so we decided to just go outside and talk in the blazing sunshine. Joseph wandered over, he was supposed to be at Spirit Council but I suppose he ditched and had nothing better to do with his time. We all ended up walking to the Korner Store and buying junk food. On the way back Caroline was walking with Melissa to Main Street and I stopped to say hello. Afterwards we all went home. 

When I got home I got a horrible migraine, hurried to finish washing the dishes and fell asleep until 8pm. I would have simply slept longer, however David and John were yelling in the next room and I could hear them screeching like a bunch of banshees. While I was awake, I was much too tired to get up, so I did nothing but lie there and think. It's a terrible thing for me, really. Usually at school when I'm around others my mind's pretty blank and I'm either not talking or just too numb to talk. But when I'm by myself I tend to think alot, about life, school, friends, everything in general. Sometimes I get really pessimistic with my thinking, like I did today. Is that a bad thing? Yeah. But hey, I get insane writing ideas from this type of thinking. 

Although I don't think anyone is into pointless teen angst stories.  

Not that anyone is even interested in my boring bloggage (yes there's a few, but it's hard to tell). I have a link on my myspace to my LJ, and all my friends know about it, yet they can't be bothered with taking a few minutes to read it. What if I bullshitted about them here? Well you know that's exactly what I'm gonna do. 

It's damned annoying to always be a confession stand. Sure, it's wonderful that I can hear about other people's problems and TRY to console them, but then when it becomes the other way around they don't act interested at all. Even regular shit. For example, a friend will call me up and tell me about how his/her day was shit and stuff, and then afterwards when I try and tell him/her about something that happened in class or afterschool or whatever, they reply with a "Ohh alright..." and then switch back to their over-dramatic gossip. You know what? I don't care about your life. And if you were me, you wouldn't either. I guess sometimes I just act interested out of curiousity and to be polite, but most of the time I'll go to bed that night and forget about it the next morning. 

Sometimes I wonder if I even have anything in common with these people. I probably don't, we're pretty much the opposite in every single way. I wish they were somewhat more mellow, I mean we're in high school. In a few more years, you're going to be off doing whatever you want with your life and everything that you know now that's so horrible will make a 360 degrees turnaround. Right now, you may want to "live in the moment," but really, be more laid back and mellow. Is it really worth ranting about? 

I know I'm an obvious hypocrite right here and now. [sarcasm] I guess I'm just a heartless, inconsiderate bitch whose too insensitive and lazy to even bother with other people and their lives. [/sarcasm] 

Haha sweet.

It doesn't exist.
It never did.
It never will.

Oh how pathetic.
A hope is such a cruel thing.
Optimism simply kills me now.
Looking on the bright side.
But what is this bright side?

Now I don't even have a reason.
Yet none the less, it's even worse.

No I'm not willing to die.
But I don't exactly want to live either.

No one's listening because there's nothing left to say.
I simply hate myself, and that's the only way.
How do you tackle that issue? 
I don't even understand it.

It's not about whose faced worse problems.
About how others have it worse, or others have it better.
We're not all the same.
We're not perfect.

Here goes to another sleepless night.
Of staring at a blank ceiling.
Of watching the shadows flicker.
Of waking up the next day, forgetting the last night.
And feeling numb.

Last night I went out and saw Borat with my buddies Shannon and Laura. I got there, spent nearly 10 minutes trying to find them, found them, bought a ticket and we headed in. Once we got into the theater, we noticed it was packed. There were no seats, so we ended up sitting near the front. I saw hella lots of people whom I knew from school. Shannon left for a few minutes while the previews were still playing to go get popcorn & a drink. Once she came back the popcorn was gone when it wasn't even halfway through the movie due to the fact that we all lunged for it x]

Borat is a funny movie, I'll give you that. But it's not MY type of humour. I know plenty of people in the theater were laughing, but I only found some parts funny. And, honestly, maybe you think it's hilarious but two hairy naked men rolling around on a bed is not my cup of tea.

Once the movie was over, Shannon and I got a ride to my house and she slept over. I was knocked out cold 'cause I was dead tired, and fell asleep around 12:30am. Shannon on the other hand was on msn, and had an enjoyable time going on webcam to show people that I was sleeping like a dead pig. Wonderful, thanks Shannon.

This morning Shannon's mom came and picked her up, and I got ready to go to the Pacific Mall with Natalie. I was going to bring the camera but since David was going to ImportFest that was somewhat difficult. Finally after getting there, we shopped around for a bit, bought Pocky, origami star paper and some random stuffs, then got home around 6pm.

Tomorrow I'm planning to go to Elizabeth's house, but hey I guarantee you my mother will not allow me to. So instead I'm going to have to either figure out how to take public transit, or, walk there.

I have a Science unit test on Monday on chemistry, so I'm off to study.

Everyone go listen to Hear Me Out by Frou Frou. It's such a good song <3

In Religion my class watched My Big Fat Greek Wedding, because we're now studying marriage as one of the seven sacraments. I won't lie, it's my first time seeing this movie, unlike every other one of my classmates who've already seen it. x]

Usually between period 1 and 2, I switch from my uniform pants to my Garage ones. However, it's getting harder to hide from my homeroom teacher, he seems to be popping up everywhere. I've kind of resorted to ducking behind crowds of people, bumping into others to get out of the way or just walking really fast x_o

In English we had a poetry unit test, and I don't think I did so well on it because I didn't really review.

Lastly in Careers we watched a movie about How to Survice High School. It was mostly about stereotyping and how people judge and categorize others. It was pretty cool in my humble opinion =)

I realize I blog alot more, and my entries are alot shorter heh. I wish more people blogged about their daily lives, it'd be cool to read about what's going on with them. I know that only 3 of my friends actually comes to read this, but it's still cool to know they are, even if they don't really comment ;D

P.S - Happy Birthday Peter!

Thank you, so much.

I probably would have died today without you guys. 

I don't know what really happened.

But it's nice to know that someone cares.

I'm sorry for the trouble I caused.

But because I really want to believe...

-------------------------------------------------------------

I know you'll never read this.

Because you probably haven't read this for awhile.

I probably shouldn't have told you at lunch, it probably would have been better if you'd just went straight home.

It was a real burden for you.

And you were obviously bored outta your fucking head.

I'm sorry.

But I don't know what to do now.

I don't know what's wrong.

Does everything fall from here?

Did I fuck up everything so horribly?

What do I do now...

What do I do?

You don't belong. Because now it is no longer a question of what you did do, but more of what you didn't do. Does it hurt to cry when nobody knows? Does it kill to scream when nobody hears?

And so walking into the washroom, waiting for them to finish applying their makeup, fixing their hair. Standing off to the side, not really listening to what they're really saying. Suddenly, they ask you that one question, and you realize you might have more in common with them then you would have ever imagined. They said it so bluntly, so openly, of course it would be inevitable that I had shaked my head in denial.

We all live under one sky. An ever changing sky, that never moves. Pretty stars, floating clouds. But I look up and wonder, 'Is someone else wishing for a miracle?', under this same endless sky.

Why are we so dependant on people, that we have to always be surrounded by others to sustain our own happiness. Can we not laugh as if no one else is looking, cry as if there's no tomorrow, talk as if someone was there? Why is that we find it awkward how some people are so solitary and individual, and not strange when a person is solely relying on others? Why is this considered cool, while this other characteristic isn't?

I'm not perfect. No one's perfect, and life would be boring if it were. There would be nothing to look forward to, nothing to work towards. But I'd like to believe that some things were, and some things are meant to be.

I'm so quiet. But do they ever realize it's because they're always talking?
I'm so awkward. But do they ever realize they're not funny?
I'm so weird. But do they ever realize there's no such thing as a normal?
I'm so ugly. But do they ever realize how unfortunate looking they are?
I'm so bitchy. But do they ever realize I haven't done anything?

I hate people. I hate society. I hate it, for always expecting something from everyone. As if there's such imaginary standard that you must fulfill or else you're deemed an automatic outcast.

What do I have in common with others? Nothing. 

Does that make life more interesting? Not at all. Just more lonely.

Am I making any sense to anyone? If not, it's alright. I know where I stand.

I thought I left my sweater in my locker, so by the end of the day when it's not there you could imagine my surprise. The I remembered I left it in the seat beside me in homeroom, so I rushed inside, searched the place, and didn't find it. To make it more cruel there was a brown sweater underneath the teacher's desk, I got all excited, looked underneath, and it wasn't mine. I got home and spazzed.

It's as if now that midterms are over I've resumed to my usual laziness. I got a 75% on my last English quiz, then got another 75% in Careers on my coat of arms.

I owe Cecilia $10 and I haven't paid her back yet.

When I cooked the pork slices this afternoon, I looked into the rice cooker and there wasn't any rice. What made it worse was at lunch today I barely had any of my pizza because I was selling the Civies. And what made that worse was there was no class lists for some of the grade 9 classes, so I just wrote their names down on the back of 9A. Now I realize that if they got the class lists for the missing classes, they'll probably forget the fact that I wrote the kids names on 9A. I'm going to die if those kids are forced to pay twice.

I have a science lab report due tomorrow. I've been slacking alot, all my answers for the classwork today were basically one line/one sentence.

Then there's a Careers quiz tomorrow.

Fuck -_-;

Today around 1pm, Cecilia, Chris and I went to the Pacific Mall. For the 5 hours that we were there, I bought 6 dvds (2 Anime, 4 Korean), origami paper for making stars and 2 posters (1 Bleach, 1 Naruto for John). I wasn't really in the mood to take pictures, so I only have a few from today.


She loves green tea ice cream.



This kid rocks at this game o_o;



Proud pose.



Drinking.



Kiwi bubble tea =D WIthout the tapioca.



Obvious crap attempt to hide from the camera...

Yesterday was my 15th birthday. Thank you to everyone who wished me a happy birthday and/or gave me a present. 

Lately I've been watching 1 Litre of Tears, a Japanese drama based on a true story about a girl who is suffering from Spinocerebellar Degeneration when she was only 15 years old. It sounds pretty cliche, but it's probably the saddest drama I've ever seen (I actually cried while watching it).

We get out mid terms on Monday, here's my marks so far.

Religion: 91
English: 86
Civics: 84
Science: 86
Average = 86.75%

I did pretty crappy so far this semester, I should probably get off my lazy butt and actually study some more.

Bam! That's my VIP ticket from last night.

So around noon after having lunch, Mom, Dad and me made our way to Mississauga. We got our tickets, and sat in 4th row and started watching since it already started. I got to see Adam Ho (talented guy), Kristine Sa, Trish (great as always) and many others. Partway through it I left the concert and went into the main room to buy food. I bought chips and then headed back, but then saw Chris's parents standing on the sidelines watching the concert. Mom and I said hello, and we waited until Chris came back because apparently he was looking for me. Well he came eventually, we wandered around watching the singers sign autographs and the food stands, then I ditched him and went to watch more music.

After a comedy act, a few more local singers and their ballads, I went into the VIP lobby. There were a team of break dancers practising for their act, so I stood there watching them. They were hella good, I must say! =D

Then there was a one hour break, so I went and hung with Chris. Him and his parents were squatted in the corner, asian-style HAHA.. If you ever to go to Vietnam you'll know what I mean ;D Mom made me introduce myself to her friends, they complimented me on how "tall" I've grown (well geez  I wonder why considering I last saw them when I was 8). 

Funny thing happened next. I was eating my chips and Chris said "Geez they have real food!?" So I gave him the rest of my chips, I leave for a bit and then come back and his mom says "Chris, you ate all of Tammy's chips! Go buy her another one!" AHAHAH... And she turns to me and says "Tammy, if you want to eat anything just tell Chris to buy it for you." LOL so I got some more free fooodd >:0

Intermission was over, watched Quang Le, a comedy act (really funny), and the breakdancers! Gah it was worth coming just to see those guys =)

Overall I had a good night. Even though my throat feels worse, I'm going to the doctor's later on today x]

"We only care soo much about you, because you're a girl. We don't care at all about your brothers." 

Right, so you're an ignorant negligent parent, and your sexist.  

Wonderful. Just plain wonderful.

Do you ever walk down the halls of your high school, look around and just see how so many people are so utterly shallow? You may shake your head and say no, and claim that there are many ugly people hanging out with very "cool" people. Well there you go, another shallow statement. Ever realize how our perception of what's "cool," is so utterly distorted? That an outgoing, pretty person is automatically popular and we should befriend them? Why is it that certain people think that if they hang out with this person or that person, that it'll make "you" seem cooler? That despite our hideous appearances we'll automatically be liked because we hang out with that person? Yes, I know. Appearance draws people in, personality makes them stay. But if you think about it, everyone has a unique personality, which leaves the appearance. There are many common misconceptions. 1) If you're pretty, you'll be popular 2) If you're popular, you'll have more friends Honestly, spending all your time trying to look pretty won't make you "popular." Popularity doesn't even exist. And having more friends doesn't mean anything, ever heard of "quality over quantity?" You shouldn't degrade the value of friends for the sake of having as many as possible. So some people are outgoing, and they talk a bit more. So some people are shy, and talk less. Some personalities click well with others, while some don't. And just because people don't like you, it doesn't mean you have to change to fit their expectations. You'll have much more fun just enjoying yourself without having to try and please others. Alright, it's nice to dress up, look nice. But it's better to just be yourself. It looks cooler.
Yeps, I decided to experiment with photoshop. I thought it looked kinda cool how it's all cartoonish ;D Maybe I should take a bunch of pictures of my friends and make a comic out of it LOL.

Today in Civics class I had my debate, finally after 5 days of it being postponed. The resolution was "The Allied Countries Are To Blame For The Holocaust." I was completely nervous, I was speaking way too fast, and one of my friends said I sounded like I was about to cry. In the end, I won the debate, but I don't think I won it very fairly, because I wasn't clear on certain things so my opponent couldn't really respond and plus I couldn't rebuttal twice. I don't think anyone should have won at all, but what's done is done. I'm just relieved it's over.

I forgot my lunch at home, so I borrowed $2.50 from Cecilia. Yes, fries are now $2.50, wth is this? Not only is cafe food so disgustingly overpriced, the portions are pretty much half of what they used to be. Then when I was at my locker, I noticed I had pocky in my bag. How stupid am I? How could I have forgotten the pocky =( ?

I switched my speech topic to Media Influence, because the one I have now on the pointlessness of teen angst is much too harsh (I encourage those who think life sucks to jump off a bridge). Then Friday I have a Religion project do, it's a gospel writing assignment and I'm supposed to write about 6 moments in my life when God was present. *sigh*

Yesterday I went to Wonderland with John, Chris and his friend Sam. We got there around 2pm and left around 7pm, so we didn't exactly fit in too many rides. We basically just went into the ones where there was almost no huge lines.  

At lunch had a poutine from New York Fries, i only finished half of it. We noticed that the seagulls were surrounding us, so John took my poutine, left it at the top of the hill and we stood there watching. A whole bunch of birds starting pecking at each other for the fries, and within a few seconds the paper container was rolling down the hill like a wheel, completely empty LOL. It was hilarious. 

Sam kind of ditched us and decided it would be funner for him to watch people try the electric chair at the arcade. So the rest of us went on Dragonfire & Cliffhanger. I knocked my head against the seat on Cliffhanger (ow), and decided I was going to sit out for the next ride. John felt sick after riding The Rage (who the hell makes up these gay names) and so we both sat out while Chris and Sam went on The Spinnovator (the teacups haha). 

Oh they had the Nickelodeon Parade while we were there. We had to jump over people to get through because everyone was on the sidelines watching. Chris said his friend Paul wanted to hug Patrick (that pink thing from Spongebob)  but the parade would be over by tomorrow. So Chris was going to hug Patrick himself. Too bad he chickened out. 

At the end of the day John got this expensive cotton candy ($3.99, wtf?) and we went home. A whole bunch of other shit happened that day but I can't really remember. I forgot to bring my camera, damnit.

Yesterday I had Vietnamese School, quite boring, uneventful. English class was pointless, I don't even need to go (86% english), but due to transportation inconvienences, I have to take it. During break I went to Shell and bought some candy, and chewed it loudly in annoyance. Obviously the teacher noticed I wasn't paying attention, & decided to call my name out. Or at least what she thought was my name. She looked straight at me and yelled, "Anne, Anne, ANNE!" I pretended I was listening to my music, then took out an earplug and said "I'm not Anne. That's the girl over there -_-;." Anne laughed nervously and I looked at my teacher stupidly. I answered her damned questions about literary terms and their meanings though.

Lunch finally rolled around, and David, John and Me went and ate at Buzz Buzz Pizza. The pizza there is so good, I love eating there. Unfortunately for me, some of the boys from my english class were sitting in there and it ruined my whole lunch. Could I not be rid of these idiots for even an hour?! John's lunch period finished, and me and David went, sat outside and talked for about 20 minutes to waste time. We went to class, died for the next 3 hours and finally we were finished at 5pm.

Next we had our optometrist appointment. The office dude asked if I was in my last year of high school. I looked at him and told him that I'm younger than David. He shrugged saying I look more mature. HAHA.
I went to get my eyes tested, turns out only my right eye has gotten worse, and only by a little. New glasses weren't necessary, so that was also a good sign. Then afterwards she wanted to check the pressure in my eyes, gave me some eye drops that stung. Then this plastic tube thing was meant to touch my eye, but I kept blinking and she only exceeded examining one of my eyes. Ah well, next time I suppose. We walked over the Saigon Optical, me and John picked out new glasses and David got his 6 months worth of contacts and one year supply of solution. Afterwards we ate at my favourite seafood restaurant, Xam Yu Seafood (it's at the intersection of Baldwin Street and Spadina Avenue). Crab & Lobster ^^;;
 

So for the entry on today, I'd like to start if off with,

HAPPY BIRTHDAY SHANNON!

Now're you're fucking 15 bitch -_-; And by the way, you'll never, ever be able to guess my birthday =) So quit it.

Moving along, I woke up this morning around 10am. I got ready, then Mom dropped me off at the mall and me and Shannon walked from there to the bus station. We found out that we missed the bus, and we'd have to wait another half hour for the next one. So then we took a taxi, effing taxi driver was a cheapass, he took the long way and it ended up being $10.

We arrived at Cora's, the line was out the door. Waited a bit and finally got a table. No one else showed so we ate our waffles (Banana and Chocolate Hazelnut, which was so sweet!) and finally called Claudia. Figures, she had completely forgotten about coming, and she was on her way. She ordered a plain waffle, ate half, then we paid and left. In that time period, Shannon told me I didn't know how to eat with a fork properly (because I hold it like a pencil, when it's supposed to be parallel to the way you hold your knife). I told her I'm ASIAN. That I'm a chopsticks person. Hah, that was my lame excuse.

We walked over to InPlay and Shannon played DDR. I shadowed her because I'm poor, and because of other reasons, and I got tired/bored. I told her I was going outside to cool down, and me and Claudia snuck into the dollar store and bought her presents. We came back, with 3 boas (black, white, red), a powerpuff Bubbles balloon, a little plastic tiara, and kanji style temporary tatoos. We all wore a random boa and walked down the street, surprisingly not dying from damned embarassment =)

I called my Mom to come pick me up, while Claudia & Shannon went into the one of the cosmetic stores. I went home, but 10-20 minutes after Claudia and Shannon showed up at my door, dragged me out and said we were going to Claudia's.

Well we arrived there 5 minutes later, and sat at the kitchen table. We had some alcohol, only a little in shot glasses. Personally I didn't like it, I generally do not like alcohol (Shannon says I don't have a "taste" for it). I've only had alcohol once before, and even now I still don't like it much. Claudia's mom was really nice, asking if I needed water/juice or something lol, but I said it's alright.

We went upstairs and Shannon wanted to go on msn so she could talk to Cam. I asked Claudia if I could use her camera (4.1 megapixel) and she said alright. Turns out I went a little crazy and took ALOT of pictures. Only reason I didn't upload much is because more then half turned out weird and I deleted them.

They didn't have much food left, so only a few people ordered. Finishing their food, Laura and Kiera were getting picked up at the place (with Shannon waiting with them), while Cecilia, Claudia and me headed back to the theater. I went to New York Fries and bought a poutine, then Claudia's dad drove me and her back home.

I ate half my poutine in the kitchen before finally throwing it out, I'd never be able to finish one of those *sigh* I'm really tired right now, but I had an overall pretty good day. But you know what sucks? I could have gone to the Pacific Mall today! But Chris's Dad couldn't find my friggen house grr >_<; Pacific Mall is this Chinese mall that has this amazing anime/manga store, and POCKY <3 Haha oh well, there's always next time.
